intro: Botrychium officinale, commonly known as the common moonwort, is a fern that belongs to the family Osmundaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often divided into segments resembling a hand. The plant produces sporangia in clusters called sorus, which are typically located on the underside of the fronds. Botrychium officinale is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
